author: Jake Polden
title: Jurgen Klopp can't find words to explain disappointment - "It would be hard in German but in English it's worse!"
text:
Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jurgen Klopp was struggling for the words to explain his disappointment after Liverpool's 3-1 defeat to Leicester City on Monday. 
Jamie Vardy put the home side in front at the King Power Stadium before Danny Drinkwater doubled the Foxes' lead. 
Vardy made it three after the break before Philippe Coutinho grabbed a late consolation, but the effort was too little too late for Klopp's men. 
Speaking to a reporter immediately after the game, Klopp took full responsibility for the poor performance and subsequent defeat. Jurgen Klopp took full responsibility for Liverpool's 3-1 defeat (Photo: Liverpool FC) Jamie Vardy celebrates scoring his side's third against the Reds (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
He also admitted that as English is not his first language he is struggling to find the correct words to really explain his frustration. 
"The language issues become a bit harder when you lose," Klopp said. 
"It's hard to find the right words. It's not that Leicester were over aggressive tonight, I think we were not physical enough. 
"They were well prepared, they were ready. They had their set pieces well thought out and we were giving throw ins away and what's frustrating is it's not like we didn't talk about that." Liverpool were beaten 3-1 at the King Power Stadium (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Klopp said his players were not physical enough against the Foxes (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"The first goal is difficult to accept and it obviously helped them a lot with momentum. It would be hard to explain my disappointment in German but in English its worse." 
Klopp reiterated this point in his press conference, telling the media: "It's easier in a foreign language to talk about victories than about defeats. There's not a lot more to say.
